body:
r? @kmcallister

(rust_highfive has picked a reviewer for you, use r? to override)

r? @alexcrichton, @aturon

@alexcrichton this is the fix for the macro issues we were discussing on IRC a few days ago.
Nice! This looks pretty great to me. Can this de-stabilize all of the internal fields of the thread local structs as well? (now that they can explicitly be left as unstable)
Updated, destabilising essentially everything in `thread_local` other than the main macro and the `Key` type.

:umbrella: The latest upstream changes (presumably #22995) made this pull request unmergeable. Please resolve the merge conflicts.

Updated; I've modified the approach and several extra commits (the `fixup! ...` one are intended as a corrections to the earlier commit, preserved for to allow you to see what changed. I'll rebase and squash post review).

I've had to add _another_ feature gating pass, because the post-expansion feature-gating pass ran before the second configuration pass, and so would miss custom attributes inserted by `cfg_attr`'s inside macro expansion: https://github.com/huonw/rust/commit/e397c4a7e51be436b5019642291cc92d18f2ee71. (I'm sure this can be done in a more rigorous way, but, it seems sensible to run feature gating on exactly the AST we compile, which this extra pass does.)

This looks good to me, r=me.

Could you also knock out some [`#[stable]` attributes in `sys_common::thread_local`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/3b3bb0e682c2d252e9f62dd9df5cff9552af91ad/src/libstd/sys/common/thread_local.rs#L87) as well as part of this PR? They're reexported through `std::thread_local::__imp` currently.
:hourglass: Testing commit b5c6ab2 with merge ffb90ea...
